.. _`10_2_0_powerscript`:

Powerscript
###########

Some changes in Powerscript code may be relevant to your customizing. You should
review (and possibly adapt) your code having read this document.


Import Names
============

Powerscript classes have been renamed and moved across modules. Please check
both your code and configuration elements for references to old names.

:envvar:`cs.workflow.SchemaComponent`
    Renamed to :envvar:`cs.workflow.schemacomponents.SchemaComponent`

:envvar:`cs.workflow.Process`
    Renamed to :envvar:`cs.workflow.processes.Process`

:envvar:`cs.workflow.AdHocWorkflow`
    Removed (see :ref:`10_2_0_cancelations`)

:envvar:`cs.workflow.ObjectRole`
    Removed (see :ref:`10_2_0_cancelations`)

:envvar:`cs.workflow.ObjectRule`
    Removed (see :ref:`10_2_0_cancelations`)

:envvar:`cs.workflow.ObjectReference`
    Removed. A similar behavior is offered by
    :envvar:`cs.workflow.briefcases.BriefcaseReference`
    (see :ref:`powerscript_reference`)

:envvar:`cs.workflow.MasterObjectReference`
    Removed. A similar behavior is offered by
    :envvar:`cs.workflow.briefcases.BriefcaseReference`
    (see :ref:`powerscript_reference`)

:envvar:`cs.workflow.TaskGroup`
    Renamed to :envvar:`cs.workflow.taskgroups.TaskGroup`

:envvar:`cs.workflow.ParallelTaskGroup`
    Renamed to :envvar:`cs.workflow.taskgroups.ParallelTaskGroup`

:envvar:`cs.workflow.SequentialTaskGroup`
    Renamed to :envvar:`cs.workflow.taskgroups.SequentialTaskGroup`

:envvar:`cs.workflow.ManualTaskGroup`
    Removed (see :ref:`10_2_0_cancelations`)

:envvar:`cs.workflow.Task`
    Renamed to :envvar:`cs.workflow.tasks.Task`

:envvar:`cs.workflow.ExecutionTask`
    Renamed to :envvar:`cs.workflow.tasks.ExecutionTask`

:envvar:`cs.workflow.ApprovalTask`
    Renamed to :envvar:`cs.workflow.tasks.ApprovalTask`

:envvar:`cs.workflow.ExaminationTask`
    Renamed to :envvar:`cs.workflow.tasks.ExaminationTask`

:envvar:`cs.workflow.InformationTask`
    Removed (see :ref:`10_2_0_cancelations`)

:envvar:`cs.workflow.Protocol`
    Renamed to :envvar:`cs.workflow.protocols.Protocol`


Status Changes
==============

Previously, all behavior controlling a Workflow's progress was implemented in
its status change User Exits (see :ref:`changes_statuschange`). Now, they are
refactored to be dedicated operations.

If you extended status change logic, you might have to migrate your code to the
methods ``propagate_done``, ``propagate_cancel``, and ``propagate_refuse`` of
Task Groups and Workflows.


.. _`powerscript_reference`:

Powerscript References
======================

The class :envvar:`cs.workflow.MasterObjectReference` was removed. If you use
this class in your code, you will have to either remove your code, or refactor
it to use :envvar:`cs.workflow.briefcases.BriefcaseReference`. This class also
contains the reference :envvar:`ReferredObject`.
